text: Rushema Begum (born 1933/1934 – died 9 July 2019) was an Bangladeshi teacher and politician who was elected as Member of 11th Jatiya Sangsad of Reserved Seats for Women. She was a politician of Bangladesh Awami League. ==Biography== Rushema Begum had started her career as a teacher of Ishan Memorial High School of Faridpur District. Later, she had become the Headmistress of the institution too. Her husband Imamuddin Ahmad was elected as an MP in First General Election of Bangladesh from Faridpur-5 (now Faridpur-3). He was connected to the politics of Bangladesh Awami League. Rushema Begum was elected as a Member of 11th Jatiya Sangsad of Reserved Seats for Women on 16 February 2019. She had died on 9 July 2019 in Faridpur Heart Foundation Hospital at the age of 85. ==References== Category:Awami League politicians Category:People from Faridpur District Category:11th Jatiya Sangsad members Category:Bangladeshi academics Category:2019 deaths Category:1930s births Category:Date of birth missing Category:Women members of the Jatiya Sangsad
title: Rushema Begum
